intro: Conothamnus trinervis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed everlastings, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Conothamnus trinervis is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
